subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 06 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live - Faroe Is 0-2 Scotland
Scotland lead the Faroe Islands 2-0 in their Euro 2008 qualifier but they are not having things all their own way.



 
Reds hero Smith has heart attack
Former Liverpool captain Tommy Smith is in hospital after suffering a heart attack at his home.



 
West Ham sign Parker in £7m deal
West Ham complete the £7m signing of midfielder Scott Parker from Newcaste.








GOLF




Mickelson to be fit for US Open
Phil Mickelson says his wrist injury will not stop him playing at the US Open despite pulling out of this week's St Jude Championship in Memphis.



 
Davies eyes Tiger's US Open trail
Welsh amateur Rhys Davies  says he will not be overawed at the US Open after his shock qualifying win.



 
Tiger prepares to take baby break
Tiger Woods says his schedule for the rest of 2007 is up in the air as he awaits the arrival of his first child.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton criticised by Villeneuve
Former world champion Jacques Villeneuve accuses rising star Lewis Hamilton of "chopping" rivals at the start of Grands Prix.



 
Massa predicts Ferrari fightback
Ferrari will bounce back from a poor Monaco Grand Prix to contest victory in Canada, says driver Felipe Massa.



 
Hutchinson clinches first TT win
Yorkshire's Ian Hutchinson wins the 600cc Supersport race at the Isle of Man races.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton criticised by Villeneuve
Former world champion Jacques Villeneuve accuses rising star Lewis Hamilton of "chopping" rivals at the start of Grands Prix.



 
Massa predicts Ferrari fightback
Ferrari will bounce back from a poor Monaco Grand Prix to contest victory in Canada, says driver Felipe Massa.



 
Valencia secures F1 street race
Valencia signs its contract to  host a Grand Prix around the Spanish city's streets from 2008.








ATHLETICS




Pickering wins battle of Britain
Craig Pickering wins the battle of the Brits as he storms home in the all-British 100m at the Glasgow Grand Prix.



 
Weir leads strong British display
Dave Weir wins four races at the Swiss Open event in Ibach.



 
Gay misses out on sprint record
Tyson Gay wins the 100m in New York but is denied a world record as his run was wind-assisted.








CYCLING




Boardman voices Wiggins concerns
British cycling legend Chris Boardman warns Bradley Wiggins he faces "massive pressure" to succeed in this year's Tour de France.



 
Pendleton eyes tough road ahead
British track cycling star Victoria Pendleton is not ruling out doubling up with road racing for the 2012 Olympics.



 
Ex-team boss denies drug claims
Former Telekom team manager Walter Godefroot denies being involved in the doping of riders during the 1990s.








FUN AND GAMES




Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport



 
Hatton gets new nickname
Boxer changing his name to the 'Manchester Mexican'



 
Quotes of the Week
Graham Poll on his yellow peril, plus Frankie Dettori and the legendary Sid Waddell
